Text.Value: So NIghtsong is not only a person - she's a living sacrifice.
|So the Nightsong is indeed a person, and a sacrifice at that.|
|So the Nightsong is indeed a person, and a sacrifice at that.|
The Nightsong awaits. A living sacrifice to the Mistress of the Night.
The Nightsong's a person indeed - and a sacrifice to the Dark Goddess, at that.
So the Nightsong is indeed a person, and a sacrifice at that.
|Halsin line|
|Minthara Line|
So this Nightsong is a person? A blood sacrifice? She's a cruel one, your lady.
The Nightsong is no ordinary offering. If the Nightsong is a person, then it's blood Shar demands...
|But this sounds like Nightsong's a real person|
So the Nightsong is no relic, but a living sacrifice - a blood offering to your vain goddess.
Then the Nightsong is no relic - but a person. A living sacrifice to the Dark Goddess.
So the Nightsong is a real, living being. Not an effigy, or a relic. A blood sacrifice.
Trapped down here for centuries. A living hell, no doubt.
|Reacting to confirmation that NS is a person|
|Reacting to confirmation that NS is a person|
This is Shar's way. So vain is the goddess that she requires a blood offering to appease her.
Alive and abandoned for what - years? Centuries? I can barely fathom it.
Alive - and abandoned in this place for a very long time.
Alive, but trapped down here for years - centuries. Pitiable creature.
|Reacting to realisation that NS is a person|
|Reacting to realisation that NS is a person|
This is Shar's way. So vain is the goddess that she requires a blood offering to appease her.
A sacrifice, abandoned for what - years? Centuries? I can barely fathom it.
Alive, but abandoned in this place for years? Hells, just what are we going to find down here?
A blood sacrifice no less? Your Lady is crueller than I thought.
Shar isn't known for her mercy. Though I thought a more merciful heart lay within you...
|Reaction to SH's intention to sacrifice Nightsong (already knew NS was a person|
Such is Shar's way. So vain is the goddess that she requires a blood offering to appease her.
This is Shar's will - to spill the Nightsong's blood with no compunction?
But this confirms what we knew already - the Nightsong is a living being, not some symbolic sacrifice.
The Nightsong lies ahead. I need that spear, or I won't be able to make a sacrifice to Lady Shar.
I was hoping for a valuable relic. But no, Nightsong's a living person.
|Wow I can't believe Nightsong is a living being|
|Wow I can't believe Nightsong is a living being|
Then the Nightsong is a person. A blood sacrifice, more precisely.
The Nightsong is no relic. It's a person - and a sacrifice.
So the Nightsong's no relic, but a living being? And a sacrifice at that?
The Nightsong lies ahead. Lady Shar will soon have her sacrifice, by my hand.
The Nightsong is an offering to Lady Shar - nothing more. But first, I need that spear.
The Nightsong is an offering to Lady Shar - nothing more. The spear will at least make it quick.

Synopsis:
The player has read the plaque outside the entrance to Nightsong's Prison and the characters are reacting appropriately:
- discovering Nightsong is a living being for the first time
- confirming that same fact after learning it elsewhere
- if Shadowheart, iterating her desire to sacrifice Nightsong/retrieve the spear required to do so.
- reacting to Shadowheart’s desire to sacrifice Nightsong to Shar, with variables depending on if they’re just learning Nightsong is a living being here or not.
